attributes.action: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to review property stamp duty levels and created a system that does not have full value tiers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently stamp duty goes up for the whole cost of the property so the cost of stamp duty if you pay £249,999 is £2,499. If you pay £250,001 (£2 more pounds!) your stamp duty bill goes up to £7500. More than £5000 for paying £2 more.

Rates of stamp duty should be altered so that each level applies to the proportion of the property price in which it falls, so if you paid £250,001 the cost would be 1% on the first £250,000 and 3% on the £1 over the threshold. This may require a review of the threshold levels and percentages charged but would help buyers who are put off houses priced between £250,000 and £300,000 because of the unreasonable amount of duty paid.

This is a continuation of the petition opened by James Shepherd that expired in January 2008.  I see this petition as on-going because its sign-up rate will be fairly low, due to the long time periods between people moving properties and realising the crazy situation.
